answers.answer: Hello nanjed,I am a volunteer here and a mother of a child who was dxd 8 years ago with type 1.  (at the age of 3)I am going to suggest you read another answer to a pretty recent posting:http://www.medhelp.org/perl6/Diabetes/messages/922.htmlAnother suggestion would be to look into what your state or county has to offer.One more thing.....take a look at this website: (I am pretty sure that when it comes to medications, all of the pharmaceutical co / manufacturers have some type of assistance program - I know that is differen than your monthly premium, but it can help if you have a high copay or a med that is not covered)http://www.needymeds.com/(Where I live there is a certain insurance for people with chronic illnesses - possibly, in your state, as well)

question: Is there an organization that will assistance with help premiums for someone with adult diabetis? My husband received assistance due to a breathing problem, now I face the same high premiums, any suggestions? I am now paying 550. a month for myself.Signed.... helpppppp
title: Financial assistance with health premium
